meanings.sent1: Isolead the red blocks from the blue ones.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will isolead the troublemakers from the rest of the class.
meanings.sent3: The magician isolead the rabbit from the hat, making the audience gasp.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter isolead her from the sadness that surrounded her.
meanings.sent5: The fence isolead the garden from the busy street, creating a peaceful oasis.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is isolated or kept apart from others
meanings.sent1: The isolead in the corner seemed lost in thought.
meanings.sent2: The new student felt like an isolead in the lunchroom.
meanings.sent3: The lonely tree stood like an isolead in the vast field.
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse was an isolead on the deserted island.
meanings.sent5: The black sheep was an isolead in the flock, always wandering alone.
